item.title: Distributions with Thin and Fat Tails
item.description: In this post, we’ll explore a key difference between thin and fat tailed distributions, and what this means in the world of insurance and risk management. These results are from Chapter 3 of Taleb (2020). In the world of thin tails (i.e. data that are Gaussian distributed), as the sample of data gets larger, no single data point can change the properties of the entire sample (Taleb calls this “Mediocristan”).
